page.title: 09GLENCORSE BARRACKS,PENICUIK
page.content: The land which is now the barracks was owned by Mrs. Cooper who sold the land for Â£10,000. In 1804-1837 the land was a French Prisoner of War Camp. After that it was a Military Prison. The men who died there were buried where the old station was and there is a monument to them. From 1881-1960 it was a Royal Scots Depot. It was closed in 1960 and opened in 1964 as a depot for the seven Scottish Regiments. There are over 500 men in the barracks at present. They stay there for 16 weeks initial training then they go to different battalions stationed throughout the world. The regiments which the men can join are First Royal Scots, Royal Highland Fusiliers, Queen's Own Highlanders, King'S Own Scottish Borderers and the Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders.
